snippet: In an effort to ensure courts would remain open during a budget impasse, Gov. Sam Brownback of Kansas signed into law a bill that funds the judiciary as long as it doesn’t strike down a 2014 law that reduced some if its authority.
abstract: Kansas Gov Sam Brownback signs into law a bill specifying that judiciary will lose funding if it strikes down 2014 law removing some powers from State Supreme Court; critics call law attempt by Brownback to stack district courts with judges favorable to his policies.
lead_paragraph: In an effort to ensure courts would remain open during a budget impasse, Gov. Sam Brownback of Kansas signed into law a bill that funds the judiciary as long as it doesn’t strike down a 2014 law that reduced some if its authority.

headline.main: Courts Budget Intensifies Kansas Dispute Over Powers
headline.print_headline: Caveat in Courts Budget Adds Fuel to Kansas Feud
